ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That We created man in toil and trouble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily We have created man into toil and hardship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: that We have created the human being to face a great deal of hardship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have indeed created man surrounded by hardships.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We have created man in Kabad.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Certainly We have created man to be in distress.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: indeed, We created man in trouble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: We verily have created man in an atmosphere:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: that We have created man into a life of toil and trial.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Assuredly We have created man in trouble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: certainly We created man in travail.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily We have created man into toil and struggle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We have created man in toil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We created the human in fatigue.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: We have certainly created man into hardship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [90:4] We certainly created man (al-insān: the generic noun) in travail, in [a state of] toil and hardship, struggling with the tribulations of this world and the calamities of the Hereafter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (We verily have created man) i.e. Kildah Ibn Usayd (in an atmosphere) in an erect form; it is also said that this means: in strife with the matter of the life of this world and of the Hereafter; and it is also said this means: with strength and force:
